You are able to enter this bodhisattva's samÄdhi of great wisdom and light. The buddhas of the worlds of the ten directions, as numerous as dust motes, all have the same name, and they empower you with their majestic spirit.
Namely:
By the power of Vairocana Buddha's original vows;
By the power of his original majestic spirit;
Because you have great wisdom;
In order to proclaim the inconceivable Dharma illumination of all bodhisattvas and buddhas.
Namely:
In order to enter the stage of wisdom;
In order to gather all wholesome roots;
In order to skillfully discriminate all buddha-dharmas;
Because of the vast Dharma wisdom;
In order to decisively explain all dharmas;
Because of skillfully discriminating non-discriminating cognition;
Because all worldly dharmas cannot defile it;
Because supramundane wholesome roots are purified;
Because of attaining inconceivable wisdom-power;
Because of attaining the realm of cognition of the omniscient one.
Namely:
Because of truly explaining the distinctions of the ten bodhisattva grounds;
Because bodhisattvas abide in the ten grounds;
Because of distinguishing the uncontaminated dharmas;
Because of adorning oneself with the great wisdom-light and skillful discrimination;
Because of entering the gate of perfect cognition;
Because of explaining in sequence according to the proper abodes;
Because of attaining the unobstructed light of eloquent explanation;
Because of being endowed with the stage of great unobstructed cognition;
Because of not forgetting the bodhisattva mind;
Because of teaching and maturing all realms of sentient beings;
Because of attaining the definitive cognition that reaches everywhere.
Vajra Treasury!
You should explain the distinctions of this Dharma door.
Namely:
Because of the spiritual power of the buddhas;
Because you are able to endure the wisdom and spiritual power of the TathÄgata;
Because your own roots of goodness are pure;
Because of the pure Dharma realm;
Because of benefiting sentient beings;
Because of entering the Dharma body and wisdom body;
Because of receiving the prophecy of all Buddhas;
Because of attaining a body that is lofty and great in all worlds;
Because of transcending all worldly paths;
Because of purifying supramundane roots of goodness.

At that time, the Buddhas of the ten directions bestowed upon Vajra Treasury the true and unsurpassed body, unobstructed eloquence in speaking, pure wisdom in skillful discrimination, the ability to remember well without forgetting, the wisdom of good determination, the ability to reach the stage of omniscience, the indestructible power of all Buddhas, the fearlessness of all Buddhas, the unobstructed wisdom of all Buddhas to distinguish and expound the Dharma, and the supreme physical, verbal, and mental actions of all Buddhas.
Why is it so?

Because he has attained the bodhisattva's great wisdom light samadhi, and also because of the bodhisattva's power of original vows, his straightforward mind is pure, his wisdom is clear, he has well accumulated the dharmas that assist the Way, he has well cultivated his original practices, he has remembered immeasurable dharmas, he has faith and understanding of the pure and bright Dharma, he has well attained the indestructible gate of dharanis, and he has been well sealed by the Dharma realm wisdom seal.
At that time, the Buddhas of the ten directions all extended their right hands and patted Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva on the head;
Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva then arose from samadhi and said to the bodhisattvas:
All Buddha's disciples!

These bodhisattva vows are certain, without transgression, indestructible, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, covering all the Buddha lands and sentient beings in the ten directions, in order to save and liberate all worlds, and are protected by the spiritual powers of all Buddhas.
Why is it so?
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas enter the stage of wisdom of the buddhas of the past, and also enter the stage of wisdom of the buddhas of the future and present.
What are the stages of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?

The stages of wisdom of the bodhisattvas are ten, which have been taught, are being taught, and will be taught by the buddhas of the past, future, and present. For the sake of these stages, I teach in this way.
What are the ten?

The first is Joyful, the second is Stainless, the third is Luminous, the fourth is Radiant, the fifth is Hard-to-conquer, the sixth is Manifested, the seventh is Far-reaching, the eighth is Immovable, the ninth is Good Wisdom, and the tenth is Dharma Cloud.
These ten stages have been taught, are being taught, and will be taught by the buddhas of the three times. I do not see any buddha-land where these ten stages are not taught.
Why is this?
These ten stages are the supreme wonderful path of the bodhisattvas, the supreme bright and pure Dharma door;
That is to say:
Distinguishing the ten grounds.
Buddha's disciples!
This matter is inconceivable, namely:
The wisdom of the bodhisattvas in accordance with the grounds.
Having spoken the names of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva remained silent and did not explain further;
At that time, all the bodhisattvas, having heard the names of the ten grounds of the bodhisattvas, were all eager to hear the explanation and each thought like this:
For what causes and conditions did Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva speak the names of the ten grounds and then remain silent?
At that time, within the great assembly of bodhisattvas, there was a bodhisattva named Liberation Moon, who knew the thoughts in the minds of the bodhisattvas and asked in verse:
Why did the pure, mindful, and wise one speak the names of the bodhisattvas'
grounds and then remain silent without explaining?
Now the minds of the great bodhisattvas are all filled with doubt,
Why is it called this, yet its meaning is not explained?
The greatly wise bodhisattvas all wish to hear
The meaning of these various stages, please explain it in detail.
This assembly of bodhisattvas is pure, without defilement,
Abiding firmly in the essence, endowed with wisdom and virtue.
All with respectful minds, they look up to you,
Wishing to hear what is said, like one thirsty thinking of sweet dew.
Then Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva, having heard this, wished to delight the assembly and replied in verse, saying:
The practices of the bodhisattvas are foremost, difficult to conceive,
Discerning these ten stages, the root of all buddhas.
Subtle and extremely difficult to see, beyond the capacity of the mind,
Emerging from the Buddha's wisdom, if heard, one will be confused and overwhelmed.
Upholding the mind like vajra, deeply believing in the Buddha's wisdom,
Considering it the most wonderful, the mind without doubt or difficulty.
Far removed from the mind that conceives of a self, and the stages of mental activity,
Such bodhisattvas are then able to listen and hear.
The wisdom of quiescent extinction and purity is extremely difficult to explain in detail,
Like painting in the sky, like grasping at a swift wind.
I think of the Buddha's wisdom, the most difficult to conceive of,
Few beings are able to believe it, therefore I remain silent.
Bodhisattva Moon of Liberation, having heard this, said to Bodhisattva Vajra Treasury:
Buddha's disciple!

This great assembly of bodhisattvas is straightforward and pure in mind, well practicing the bodhisattva path, well accumulating the factors that assist the path, and well respectfully making offerings to the buddhas;

They have planted various wholesome roots with immeasurable buddhas, accomplished immeasurable profound and thick merits and virtues, are free from delusion, doubt, and regret, are without attachment and all bonds and hindrances, have profound faith and understanding, abide firmly and unmoved, and in this Dharma do not follow the teachings of others.
Therefore, Buddha's disciples!
You should rely on the Buddha's power to expound this meaning, and these bodhisattvas will all be able to realize and know this profound Dharma.
At that time, the bodhisattva Vimukti-candra, wanting to restate this meaning, spoke in verse, saying:
Please explain the peaceful Dharma, the unsurpassed practice of the bodhisattvas,
Analyze the various stages, causing wisdom to be pure.
The pure and stainless wisdom of the multitudes, abiding in profound faith and understanding,
In the immeasurable buddhas, realizing and knowing the meaning of the ten stages.
The bodhisattva Vajra Treasury said:
Buddha's disciples!
Although this great assembly is all pure, free from delusion, doubt, and regret, and in this Dharma does not follow the teachings of others;
Those who delight in the lesser Dharma, upon hearing this profound and inconceivable matter, may give rise to doubt and regret, and this person will for a long time experience various misfortunes;
I have compassion for them, and for this reason I remain silent.
At that time, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke in verse, saying:
Although this assembly is pure, with profound wisdom free from doubt and regret,
Their minds have already been determined, and they will no longer follow the teachings of others.
Unmoving like Mount Sumeru, unconfused like the great ocean,
Those who have not practiced for a long time, whose wisdom is not yet clear,
Following consciousness, not following wisdom, upon hearing this they give rise to doubt and regret,
They are about to fall into the evil paths, out of compassion I do not speak.
Liberation Moon Bodhisattva said:
Buddha's disciple!
May you, relying on the Buddha's power, skillfully discern this inconceivable Dharma, the matter that the Buddha has in mind, causing it to be easily believed and understood;
Why is this?
Well expound the meaning of the ten grounds, the Dharma of the Buddhas of the ten directions should protect and think of them;
All bodhisattvas protect this matter and diligently practice diligently.
Why is it so?
Because this is the supreme practice of bodhisattvas, leading to the attainment of all the Buddhadharmas.
It is like all written characters, which are all included in the initial chapter. The initial chapter is the basis, and there is not a single character that does not enter the initial chapter;
In the same way, O Buddha's disciple!
The ten grounds are the fundamental basis of all the Buddhadharmas;
Bodhisattvas fully practice these ten grounds and are able to attain omniscience.
Therefore, O Buddha's disciple!
Wish to explain this meaning, the Buddhas protect and think of them, adding their spiritual power, causing people to believe and accept it, and it cannot be destroyed.
At that time, the bodhisattva Vimukti-candra, wishing to clarify this meaning, spoke in verse, saying:
Excellent! The wise child, with pure practices complete,
Please explain the practices of the ten grounds and the dharmas entered into the ten grounds,
Fully endowed with wisdom, one may thereby accomplish enlightenment.
All the buddhas of the ten directions, the most honored among humans,
All together protect and think of you, explaining the meaning of the ten grounds.
The ten grounds are the fundamental, called the place of wisdom practice,
Also the ultimate path, the immeasurable Dharma aggregate of the Buddha.
Just as all written characters are included in the initial chapter,
The merit and wisdom of the buddhas have the ten grounds as their foundation.
At that time, the bodhisattvas simultaneously spoke in unison, requesting Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva in verse, saying:
The one of supreme and wondrous wisdom, whose pleasant speech is immeasurable,
Whose virtues are weighty like the king of mountains, compassionately explain the ten grounds.
Pure precepts, mindfulness, and wisdom, explaining the meaning of the ten grounds,
The root of the ten powers, the fundamental practice of unobstructed wisdom.
The merit of precepts, concentration, and wisdom, all gathered in your mind,
Arrogance and all wrong views have all been extinguished.
This assembly has no doubts, only wishing to hear the good teachings,
Like a sick person thinking of a good doctor, like a hungry person thinking of delicious food.
We are also like this, hearing the taste of the nectar-like Dharma,
Therefore, with a vast intention, I wish you would open the door to the first ground,
Up to the tenth ground, please explain them in order for me.

At that time, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva observed the ten directions, wishing to increase the faith and respect of the great assembly, and spoke in verse, saying:
The path of the holy king of the buddhas is subtle and extremely difficult to understand,
Not attained through thought or speculation, it is only the domain of the wise.
Its nature, from the very beginning, is tranquil and without arising or ceasing,
From the very beginning it is empty, eliminating all suffering and distress.
Far removed from all destinies, equal to the characteristics of nirvana,
Without middle or end, not spoken by words.
Transcending the three times, its characteristics are like space,
The place where the buddhas practice, pure, profound, and quiescent.
Difficult to reach through words, the stages of practice are also like this,
Even speaking of it is still difficult, let alone showing it to others.
The wisdom of the buddhas is apart from the path of the mental functions,
It is inconceivable, not having the aggregates, sense bases, or elements.
It can only be known through wisdom, not by the cognitive functions,
Like a trace in the sky is difficult to describe, how can its characteristics be shown?
The meaning of the ten grounds is like this, not within the scope of the mind and thoughts,
Although this matter is difficult, one makes vows and practices compassion and mercy.
Gradually perfecting the various grounds, the wise one can reach them,
Thus the practices of the various grounds are subtle and very difficult to see.
They cannot be known by the mind, one should rely on the Buddha's power to explain,
You all should be respectful, all listen single-mindedly together.
In accordance with wisdom, the characteristics and practices of the various grounds enter,
In countless hundreds of millions of eons, speaking of them cannot exhaust them.
Now briefly explaining the truth, its meaning is without remainder,
Respectfully waiting with single-minded reverence, now I will speak by the Buddha's power,
With the great sound proclaiming causes and analogies, the meaning and names are not contradictory.
The Buddha's spiritual power is immeasurable, now all is in my body,
What I speak is like a drop in the great ocean.
Having spoken this verse, Vajra Treasury Bodhisattva addressed the great assembly, saying:
Disciples of the Buddha!

If sentient beings thickly accumulate wholesome roots, cultivate wholesome practices, well gather the methods that assist the Way, make offerings to the Buddhas, accumulate all pure dharmas, are protected by good and virtuous friends, enter the profound and vast mind, delight in the great Dharma, and their minds often turn to compassion and kindness, and like to seek the Buddha's wisdom;
Such sentient beings are then able to give rise to the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment.

In order to attain omniscience, to attain the ten powers, to attain great fearlessness, to attain the complete Buddha Dharma, to save all worlds, to purify the great compassionate mind, to head towards the unobstructed cognition of the ten directions without remainder, to purify all Buddha lands without remainder, to know the events of the three times in a single thought, and to freely turn the great Dharma wheel and extensively manifest the Buddha's spiritual powers, the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva gives rise to such a mind.
Buddha's disciples!
This mind takes great compassion as the foremost, with wisdom as the superior, and is protected by skillful means;
The mind of uprightness and profound sincerity is vast and equal to the power of the Buddha;
The power of determining sentient beings and the power of the Buddha leads towards unobstructed cognition and accords with natural cognition;
It is able to receive all Buddha Dharmas and teach with wisdom, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, and extending to the end of the future.

When bodhisattvas give rise to this mind, they immediately transcend the stage of ordinary beings and enter the stage of bodhisattvas. They are born in the Buddha's family, with a noble lineage, beyond reproach.
They transcend all worldly paths and enter the supramundane path.

Abiding in the bodhisattva teachings, they are counted among the bodhisattvas. They equally enter the lineage of the tathÄgatas of the three times, and are destined to ultimately attain supreme perfect enlightenment. Bodhisattvas abiding in such teachings are called abiders in the stage of joy, because they abide in unshakable states.
Buddha's disciples!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abiding in the stage of joy have much joy, much faith, much purity, much exhilaration, much pliancy, much endurance, do not like disputes, do not like to vex or disturb sentient beings, and do not like to be angry or resentful.
Buddha's disciples!
The bodhisattvas abiding in this stage of joy give rise to a mind of joy by recollecting the buddhas;
they give rise to a mind of joy by recollecting the buddhas' teachings;
Thinking of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the practices of the bodhisattvas, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the pure characteristics of the perfections, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the superiority of the bodhisattvas over the masses, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the indestructibility of the bodhisattvas' powers, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the teaching of transforming beings by the tathÄgatas, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the ability to benefit sentient beings, one gives rise to a joyful mind;
Thinking of the wisdom and skillful means that all buddhas and bodhisattvas enter, one gives rise to a joyful mind.
The bodhisattva further thinks like this:
'I am turning away from all worldly realms, and I give rise to a joyful mind;
Entering into the equality of all buddhas, I give rise to a joyful mind;
Far removed from the stage of ordinary beings, I give rise to a joyful mind;
Approaching the stage of wisdom, I give rise to a joyful mind;
They give rise to a joyful mind, thinking, 'I will sever all evil destinies.'
They give rise to a joyful mind, thinking, 'I will become a support for all sentient beings.'
They give rise to a joyful mind, thinking, 'I will approach and see all Buddhas.'
They give rise to a joyful mind, thinking, 'I will be born in the realms of the Buddhas.'
They give rise to a joyful mind, thinking, 'I will enter the ranks of all Bodhisattvas.'
They give rise to a joyful mind, thinking, 'I will be free from all fears.'
Why is it so?
Because when a Bodhisattva attains the ground of joy, all fears are immediately eliminated.
Namely:
Fear of not surviving, fear of bad reputation, fear of death, fear of falling into evil destinies, fear of the majestic virtue of the great assembly - all such fears are eliminated.
Why is it so?
Because this Bodhisattva is free from the notion of self, and does not even crave for his own body, let alone the things he uses.
Therefore, the Bodhisattva has no fear of not surviving;

The mind does not hope for respectful offerings and worship, thinking I should make offerings to sentient beings and provide for their needs. For this reason, the bodhisattva has no fear of a bad reputation.
Far removed from the view of self and the characteristics of no-self, there is no fear of death.
Moreover, one thinks like this:
After my death, wherever I am reborn, I will surely see the buddhas and bodhisattvas. For this reason, there is no fear of falling into the evil paths.
My aspirations and delights are unequaled, let alone having any superiority.
For this reason, there is no fear of the majestic virtue of the great assembly.
In this way, the bodhisattva is forever free from all terrifying events.
Buddha's disciples!

This bodhisattva, with great compassion as the foremost, has no resentment in his mind towards any sentient being. His mind is upright and firm, naturally pure, and he further diligently cultivates all wholesome roots.
Namely:ğŸ”½With increasing faith, he often practices pure thoughts;
With a clear understanding mind, he often distinguishes with a faithful mind.

Giving rise to great compassion, accomplishing great kindness, with an unwearied mind, adorned with shame and humility, accomplishing patience and gentleness, respectfully following the teachings of the Buddha, and revering good and wise advisors;
Day and night always cultivating all wholesome roots, always delighting in the Dharma, seeking much learning without weariness;

As for the Dharma that is heard, correctly contemplating it with mindfulness, the mind not attached to it, not seeking fame, not seeking material gain or the necessities of life, always giving rise to a precious mind, never being content;

Delighting in the stage of omniscience, wishing to attain the powers, fearlessness, and unique qualities of the buddhas, seeking to assist in the practices of the perfections, being free from flattery and deceit, and being able to practice as taught;

Always practicing true speech, not defiling the Buddha's family, not abandoning the bodhisattva precepts, giving rise to the mind of omniscience, unshakable like the king of mountains, not delighting in worldly affairs, accomplishing supramundane wholesome roots, gathering wholesome aids to enlightenment, never being content, always seeking the supreme among supreme paths, the bodhisattva who accomplishes such pure stages is called abiding in the stage of joy.
The bodhisattva thus abiding in the stage of joy gives rise to great vows and gives rise to such a determined mind.
Namely:
I shall make offerings to all buddhas without exception with a pure mind, making offerings with all offering implements according to my wishes;

Giving rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, lasting until the end of the future, making offerings to all buddhas in all kalpas with great offering implements without rest.

Moreover, all the sutras and Dharma spoken by all Buddhas are completely upheld, embracing the supreme, perfect enlightenment of all Buddhas. In accordance with the teachings of all Buddhas, all Buddha-dharmas are completely guarded. Giving rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, extending to the end of the future, completely guarding all Buddha-dharmas in all kalpas without rest.

Moreover, in all worlds, when all Buddhas descend from Tuá¹£ita Heaven, enter the womb, dwell in the womb, are first born, leave home, attain Buddhahood, are requested to turn the great Dharma wheel, and demonstrate entering great nirvÄá¹‡a, I will go to make offerings to them all, with the Dharma as the foremost, turning in the three periods of time. Thus I give rise to this great vow, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, extending to the end of the future, to the end of all kalpas, welcoming and making offerings to all Buddhas without rest.

Moreover, all the practices of the bodhisattvas are vast and immeasurable, indestructible, and without discrimination. They are embraced by the perfections, purified by the stages, and give rise to various auxiliary practices. They have general and specific characteristics, both form and no form, both accomplishment and destruction. All the stages and practices of the bodhisattvas, as well as the fundamental practices of the perfections, teach and transform all beings, enabling them to accept and practice, and their minds to increase and grow. They give rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, extending to the end of the future, and throughout all kalpas. Within the practices of the bodhisattvas, they teach and transform sentient beings to maturity, without rest.

Moreover, all sentient beings, whether with form or formless, with thought or without thought, neither with thought nor without thought, born from eggs, wombs, moisture, or by transformation, bound to the three realms, entering the six destinies and all places of birth, are subsumed within name and form;
Teaching and transforming, bringing to maturity, cutting off all worldly paths, causing them to abide in the Buddha's teachings and all wisdom, leaving none behind;

Giving rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, extending to the end of the future, to the end of all kalpas, teaching and transforming all sentient beings without rest.

Moreover, the vast, narrow, and middling of all worlds, innumerable and measureless, cannot be distinguished, cannot be destroyed, cannot be moved, cannot be spoken of, are coarse and fine, upright, inverted, flat, square, and round. Entering such worlds with wisdom, like the distinctions in Indra's net, the distinctions in the worlds of the ten directions are all known directly. Giving rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, extending to the end of the future, to the end of all kalpas, such worlds are all known directly, without rest.
Furthermore, all buddha lands enter one buddha land, and one buddha land enters all buddha lands;

giving rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, exhausting the future, exhausting all kalpas, purifying such lands without rest.

Moreover, all bodhisattvas have the same mind and study together, gathering all wholesome [activities] without resentment or jealousy. They give rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, exhausting the future, exhausting all kalpas, practicing this great wisdom path without rest.

Moreover, riding the irreversible wheel, practicing the bodhisattva path, the physical, verbal, and mental actions they perform are not in vain. Those sentient beings who see them will definitely attain the Buddha's teachings;

Like the king of medicinal trees, I will attain this by practicing the bodhisattva path;

I make this great vow, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, extending to the end of the future, to the end of all kalpas, practicing the irreversible path, with my actions not in vain, without rest.

Moreover, in all worlds, I will attain supreme perfect enlightenment. In a single hair-tip, I will manifest entering the womb, leaving home, sitting on the bodhi-site, attaining buddhahood, turning the Dharma wheel, liberating beings, demonstrating great nirvana, displaying the great spiritual powers of all buddhas, and according to those beings who are to be liberated, moment by moment, I will attain the way of the buddhas;
Knowing that all dharmas are like the characteristics of nirvana, with a single sound, causing all beings to give rise to joy;
Showing the great nirvana without ceasing the practices of bodhisattvas;
Showing sentient beings the ground of great wisdom, causing them to know that all dharmas are false;
With great wisdom, spiritual powers, freedom, and emanations, filling the Dharma realm;

Giving rise to such great vows, vast like the Dharma realm, ultimate like space, exhausting future kalpas, exhausting all kalpas to attain Buddhahood, seeking great wisdom, great spiritual powers, and so forth, without rest.

If bodhisattvas definitely make this great vow, they will attain a beneficial mind, a pliant mind, a well-disciplined mind, a tranquil mind, an undistracted mind, a mind of quiescence, an upright mind, a harmonious mind, an unangry mind, and an untroubled mind.
In this way, they become believers, delighting in using faith to discern merits:

They believe in the path that all Buddhas have practiced in the past, believe in practicing the perfections and attaining growth, believe in skillfully entering the grounds and attaining sublime merits, believe in attaining the ten powers of a Buddha, believe in perfecting the four fearlessnesses, believe that the unique qualities of a Buddha are indestructible, believe that the Dharma of all Buddhas is inconceivable, believe that the spiritual powers of all Buddhas are immeasurable and boundless, believe in the immeasurable gateways of all TathÄgatas, and believe that the fruition of causes and conditions is attained.

Buddha's disciples!
The bodhisattva thinks like this:

'The true Dharma of the Buddhas is thus profound, thus free from characteristics, thus tranquil, thus empty, thus signless, thus wishless, thus undefiled, thus immeasurable, thus vast, thus difficult to destroy.

Yet ordinary beings, their minds fallen into wrong views, obscured by the darkness of ignorance and delusion, their wisdom-eye covered, always erecting the banner of pride, falling into the net of craving, following flattery, always harboring stinginess and jealousy, creating the causes for rebirth in future bodies;

Accumulating much greed, hatred, and delusion, giving rise to heavy karma, the fierce winds of resentment blowing the fire of sinful thoughts, always causing it to blaze; whatever they do is associated with perversion;

The streams of desire, existence, views, and ignorance, the continuous arising of mind, thought, and consciousness, planting seeds in the ground of the three realms, giving rise to the sprouts of suffering, namely:
Name-and-form;

Thus, through conditions, the mass of suffering is accumulated, and all kinds of suffering are experienced;
In this, there is no self, no possession of a self,
No doer, no experiencer, no knower, like grass, trees, tiles, and stones, and also like a shadow or an echo.
Foolish ordinary beings are pitiable, not knowing, not understanding, and experiencing suffering and distress;

The bodhisattvas, seeing that all sentient beings cannot escape from suffering, immediately give rise to the wisdom of great compassion, thinking, These sentient beings I should rescue and protect, causing them to abide in the bliss of the ultimate Buddha Way, and immediately give rise to the wisdom of great kindness.

his head, eyes, ears, nose, limbs, hands, and feet, he does not begrudge them because he deeply respects the Buddha.

This bodhisattva, with a mind of great compassion and great giving, in order to save all sentient beings, diligently seeks worldly and transcendent beneficial matters, with a mind free from weariness. Therefore, the bodhisattva gives rise to the merit of being free from weariness. He is able to understand the scriptures by himself, therefore he gives rise to the merit of knowing the scriptures;

Having attained such wisdom of knowing the scriptures, he is well able to discern what should and should not be done, and benefits sentient beings according to their capacities, whether superior, middling, or inferior. Therefore, the bodhisattva gives rise to the merit of worldly wisdom;

Having attained the merit of worldly wisdom, he knows the time and knows the measure, adorned with a sense of shame and dishonor, and cultivates the path of benefiting oneself and others. Therefore, he gives rise to the merit of a sense of shame and dishonor;
Such merits, he diligently practices without a lazy mind, this is the merit of not retreating from vigor, and he then attains the power of endurance;
Having attained the power of endurance, they diligently make offerings to all Buddhas and practice in accordance with the Buddha's teachings.
Buddha's disciples!
This bodhisattva fully understands the arising of such pure ground dharmas, namely:

Faith, kindness, compassion, generosity, being tireless, understanding various scriptures, skillfully understanding worldly dharmas, shame, endurance, making offerings to Buddhas, and practicing as taught.

in the same way, he is never satisfied with receiving and inquiring about the characteristics of the practice and fruition in the third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth grounds from the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and good and virtuous friends, and is never discouraged in perfecting the ten grounds.

This bodhisattva well knows the dharmas that counteract the various stages, well knows the formation and destruction of the various stages, well knows the practices and fruits of the various stages, well knows the distinctions in attaining the various stages, well knows the pure practices of the various stages, well knows the practices from one stage to another stage, well knows the proper and improper of the various stages, well knows the turning and abiding of the various stages, well knows the superior practices of the various stages, well knows the attainment of irreversibility in the various stages, and even well knows all the bodhisattva's pure stage dharmas entering the TathÄgata's stage of wisdom.

Thus, this bodhisattva well knows the practices of the various stages. Before entering the first stage, he already knows the ten stages without obstruction;
He attains the wisdom and light of the various stages, and even knows the wisdom and light of the buddhas;
Like a great caravan leader, leading many merchants, wishing to reach a great city, first asking about the road, the faults of turning back, the benefits and harms on the road;

Before setting out, he knows the route and the places to stay, and even knows how to reach that city. He can use wisdom to contemplate and calculate, and provide all the necessary provisions, so that there is nothing lacking. He leads the people correctly and reaches the great city, avoiding all dangers and difficulties on the perilous path, and both he and the people are free from worry and distress.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are also like this. Abiding in the first ground, they well know the counteractive methods of all grounds, and even well know the pure ground dharmas of all bodhisattvas, entering the TathÄgata's ground of wisdom.

At that time, the bodhisattva gathers the provisions of great merit and wisdom, and for the sake of sentient beings, as their leader, he teaches and transforms them as appropriate, causing them to escape from the perilous and difficult places of birth and death, showing them the path of peace and security, and even causing them to abide in the great city of omniscient wisdom, free from all harm.
Therefore, the bodhisattva should always be tireless in his mind, diligently cultivating the fundamental practices of the grounds, and even well knowing how to enter the TathÄgata's ground of wisdom.
